# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_internal/models/wheel.py
@source-hash: 39d73535558be4df
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:00:21Z

## Purpose
Python wheel file parser and compatibility checker for pip's internal package installation system. Extracts metadata from wheel filenames and evaluates platform/version compatibility against supported tags.

## Core Class
**Wheel (L13-93)** - Main class representing a wheel file with parsed metadata and compatibility methods.

### Key Attributes (set in __init__ L23-43):
- `filename` (L30): Original wheel filename
- `name` (L31): Package name (underscores normalized to hyphens)  
- `version` (L34): Package version (underscores normalized to hyphens)
- `build_tag` (L35): Optional build tag from filename
- `pyversions` (L36): List of Python versions from filename
- `abis` (L37): List of ABI tags from filename  
- `plats` (L38): List of platform tags from filename
- `file_tags` (L41-43): Set of all Tag combinations (Cartesian product of pyversions × abis × plats)

### Methods:
- `__init__(filename)` (L23-43): Parses wheel filename using regex, raises InvalidWheelFilename on invalid format
- `get_formatted_file_tags()` (L45-47): Returns sorted string list of all tags
- `support_index_min(tags)` (L49-65): Finds lowest index of wheel's tags in preference-ordered tag list
- `find_most_preferred_tag(tags, tag_to_priority)` (L67-86): Returns minimum priority value using tag-to-priority mapping (optimization for large tag lists)
- `supported(tags)` (L88-93): Boolean check if wheel is compatible with any of the given tags

## Dependencies
- `pip._vendor.packaging.tags.Tag` (L8): PEP 425 tag representation
- `pip._internal.exceptions.InvalidWheelFilename` (L10): Exception for malformed filenames

## Key Pattern
**Wheel Filename Parsing (L16-21)**: Complex regex extracts structured data from wheel filename format: `{name}-{version}(-{build})?-{pyver}-{abi}-{plat}.whl`

## Architecture Notes
- Uses set intersection/disjoint operations for efficient tag compatibility checking
- Normalizes underscores to hyphens following wheel naming conventions
- Generates all possible tag combinations as Cartesian product for comprehensive compatibility checking
- Provides both linear scan (support_index_min) and priority-based (find_most_preferred_tag) preference resolution methods
